column1: '''Yule''' was the [[Northern Mannish]] name of the midwinter festival
column2: observed around the [[Westlands]]. The days around Yule were the Yule-tide.
Yule referred to two days (the last of the previous and the first of the new year). Due to a peculiarity of the Calendar
column3: the 2 Yuledays were "between" and outside the formal months of [[Foreyule]] and [[Afteryule]]. They always fell on the same days of the week: the last day of the year
column6: while the first day of the following year
column8: was always a [[Sterday]] (Saturday).<ref name="Shire">{{App|Shire}}</ref><ref group=note>On a modern calendar
column9: they fell approximately on 21 and 22 December.</ref>
